series.title: Series Circuit
series.description: In a series circuit, components are connected end-to-end so the same current flows through all components.
key_points: Same current flows through all resistors
Total resistance is the sum of individual resistances
examples: Example 1: If R1 = 25Ω, R2 = 50Ω, and R3 = 75Ω, then R_total = 25 + 50 + 75 = 150Ω.
Example 2: If R1 = 10Ω and R2 = 20Ω, then R_total = 30Ω.

parallel.title: Parallel Circuit
parallel.description: In a parallel circuit, components are connected across the same voltage source.
key_points: Total resistance is less than the smallest resistor
examples: Example 1: If R1 = R2 = R3 = 150Ω, then 1/R_total = 1/150 + 1/150 + 1/150 = 3/150, so R_total = 50Ω.
Example 2: If R1 = 10Ω and R2 = 20Ω, then R_total = 1 / (1/10 + 1/20) ≈ 6.67Ω.
